nl: Let $p$ be an odd prime. Show that $a$ is a primitive root modulo $p$ iff $a^{(p-1) / q} \not \equiv 1(p)$ for all prime divisors $q$ of $p-1$.
lean:
∀ {p : ℕ} {a : ZMod p} (hp : Odd p) (hp' : p.Prime) :
  IsPrimitiveRoot a p ↔ (∀ q, ℕ, q ∣ (p-1) → q.Prime → ¬ a^((p-1)/q) = 1)
candidate: ∀ {p : ℕ} [Fact p.Prime] (h : (p : ℕ) % 2 = 1) : IsPrimitiveRoot a p ↔ ∀ q, ℕ, q.Prime → q ∣ p - 1 → a ^ ((p - 1) / q) ≠ 1
